file_content.text: I'll catch up once it's clear. Go on.
We'd better move fast.
Well, that was exciting. It's good to finally meet you in person, Captain.
Welcome to Havoc Squad, Vik.
Likewise.
Now there's something I never expected to hear. So, what does Havoc Squad do with worthless enemy bureaucrats?
You're back in the Republic Army now, Vik. Act like it.
No salute?
Heh. Yes, sir, Captain, sir. Permission to stomp that fat bureaucrat's head in, sir?
Shut up. [Punch Vik.]
You've given me nothing but trouble, Vik. I won't forget that.
Shut up. [Punch Vik.]
Ugh! Come on... haven't I had enough for one day? He's the bad guy here, not me.
Uh... let's not be hasty, now. I am a man of honor, despite what you may have heard.
Yeah, "nice guy." You stole from your people and betrayed them to the Empire by accident.
I've made mistakes, certainly. But allow me to make amends. A contribution of credits, say, to repay the Republic's heroism on behalf of my fellow Balmorrans?
I don't want your credits, Orus. Get out of here.
Just leave.
What's your offer, exactly?
That's tempting.
I'm prepared to be quite generous. Surely, no man can put a price on freedom!
Forget this. You want to take that fat scum's bribe, go for it. But I don't want anything to do with it.
Captain, we cannot harm an unarmed civilian, and we most certainly cannot accept bribes from one!
This is no bribe! I only wish to undo some of the damage that my weakness of character has caused. Put my meager credits to good use!
It could be a trick, sir--allies of the Empire are known for deceit. I'm not convinced this man loves the Republic at all!
But I do, my mechanical friend! Your heroic rescue has made clear my error! Please, accept my credits in exchange for opening my eyes.
Compensation for past transgressions does not come through purchase, but through right thought and action.
I'm... afraid you have me at a disadvantage, without my protocol droid. But surely, my earnest wish to contribute is clear in any language.
Are we in agreement, friend?
Keep your credits and leave, Orus.
No--get out of here.
Oh. Yes, yes, of course! Whatever you wish!
Should've just killed the fat scumbag.
It's a deal.
I'm so pleased to have had this opportunity. It's been a pleasure meeting you--I'll, uh, I'll find my own way out.
Hmph. I would've needed a lot more credits to leave that scumbag walking around.
I think killing you would be more satisfying.
Forget it. [Kill Orus.]
You can't buy your way out of this.
No thanks. [Kill Orus.]
No! No! Argh!
Come on, Captain. The scumbag didn't even have a weapon.
Sir! He wasn't even armed!
It's not like anyone is going to miss the guy.
Thus to all enemies of the Republic!
I know I won't miss the guy.
Surely the killing of this man was unnecessary, sir.
Hmm. Guess I'll have to learn to speak bug if this freak is in the squad.
Good riddance.
Now, seeing as we're all on the same team, I'll fill you in on my little operation.
That vault we blew open is full of pricey prototype weapons designed by Balmorran companies. Orus had them hidden before the Imperial invasion to "keep them safe."
Orus never told the Imperials about these weapons?
The Empire never knew?
Of course not. He wanted to make money on them.
You did all of this just to get the weapons for yourself, didn't you?
This whole op was a scam.
Yep. Pretty impressive work, I'd say.
Experimental blasters are right up my alley.
I can always use a new weapon.
Exactly what I was thinking.
Orus planned to sell the prototypes for a tidy profit. We could do the same--after picking a few choice items for ourselves.
Those prototypes should be put to use, not sold for profit.
Absolutely not.
I'm with you, Captain. Good men sacrificed their lives for us to get here--we've got to do right by them.
Quite right, Captain. These weapons must be turned over to the proper authorities, in accordance with Regulation 87-C.
Havoc Squad is the Republic's foremost military unit, sir. If these weapons are superior to our current equipment, our obligation is to take them.
We have walked the path that led us here, sir. Regardless of Vik's actions, perhaps our use of these weapons is for the best.
I bet you change your mind once those blasters are in front of us.
Let's just get to the vault. If we don't move fast, the Imps might find the prototypes.
You led good men into enemy territory and got them killed just to make a profit!
I can't believe you!
Those men died fighting Imperials--exactly what they volunteered for.
You're out of line, Vik! This squad does not waste lives for nothing!
This is the worst, most corrupt thing I've heard since I left Ord Mantell.
Misappropriation of Republic military assets, unauthorized operations behind enemy lines, looting, wartime profiteering... this is atrocious.
You don't like it, good for you. But if we don't get to that vault soon, the Imps will find the prototypes, and nobody wants that. Let's go.
Vik's motives may be questionable, but these prototype weapons could be a boon for the Republic's forces.
We can talk about the why's later. If we don't get to those prototypes soon, the Imps will. Let's go.
We have walked the path that Vik led us on, regardless of his reasons. Put to proper use, these prototypes could protect many lives.
If we don't get over to the vault and get those prototypes soon, the Imperials will find them.
New gear, a few credits--count me in.
Sounds good to me.
This is wrong. Completely wrong. Good men died to get us here!
This is ridiculous. Not that I would expect any better of you.
Sir... we cannot take those weapons. You don't really need me to tell you that, do you?
Sir, I know we rarely agree on matters of regulation, but this is appalling.
She's in charge, not us. I think we'd better just follow orders.
The CO has made his choice. Who are we to question orders?
Agreed. Havoc Squad should have the finest weaponry available in order to ensure maximum operational effectiveness.
If our use of these weapons can defend the many lives entrusted to us, then Yuun sees no cause for objection.
The bug can jabber at us on the move--we need to get to the vault before the Imps do. Let's go.
The vault's not far. Let's get our prize before someone else finds it.
Get me out of here!
It's done. The shield generator is disabled.
Just what I wanted to hear. I'm dying to launch this baby.
Target coordinates locked in... fire!
Whew... the Imps are really going to feel this one.
I'm glad I could help.
Sounds good to me.
Wish I could've pulled you in from the start. You've made this op a breeze.
You owe me.
I'll never forget it. Believe me.
I want your exact coordinates. Now.
Just tell me where you are.
All right, all right. So much for enjoying the moment.
I can't wait to shake your hand, Captain. See you soon.
The sensor stations are down, Vik.
Nice job. I guess they say Havoc is the best for a reason.
I have to ask, Captain--why me? I mean, sure, I'm pretty incredible. But last I heard, the guys up top weren't too interested in having me around.
Havoc Squad has to have the top explosives expert in the Republic.
My team needs the best.
And that's me, huh? I'm flattered.
You can go without the reasons for now.
The details aren't necessary.
Need to know basis, huh? What a treat.
Havoc Squad's next mission is dangerous, and no one cares if you come back.
You're expendable.
That's about what I expected.
Heh. From a dishonorable discharge to Havoc Squad in less than a year. It's a crazy galaxy.
So what's it like, being top squad in the Republic? You have Command breathing down your neck, or do they give you room to operate?
General Garza oversees all of Havoc Squad's operations personally.
We have strict oversight.
Never met Garza, but I know her reputation. I'm surprised she's willing to have me in the same sector.
As long as Havoc delivers results, nobody asks questions.
The ends justify the means.
Hmm. Sounds like my kind of job.
You just worry about following my orders to the letter. Understood?
I get slack. You don't.
This is going to be fun, I can tell already.
Only one more thing between my missile and its target: an aerial shield generator. Take it down, and we'll be go for launch, Captain.
Taking the shield down shouldn't be a problem.
Copy that.
You're a pro, no doubt about it.
Why should I trust you?
Aw, I wouldn't do that. You can trust me.
After this, no more games, Vik. We meet face-to-face.
This had better be the end.
I wouldn't have it any other way.
See you soon. Vik out.
This is ridiculous. Why are we going along with Vik's nonsense?
Captain, with all due respect, I don't think it wise to play Vik's game. He should be doing what you ask, not the other way around.
This is our only shot at catching up to him. I don't see any other options.
What choice do we have?
I guess you're right.
You're right, of course. But it's no less frustrating.
He may be playing us, but the Imperials are the ones paying for it.
It could be worse.
Yeah, that's something. Nothing is a waste of time if you're wasting Imps.
Once we get Vik in the squad, just leave him to me. I'll teach him some discipline.
Yes, at least the objectives themselves are worthwhile, even if the reasoning behind them isn't.
When we catch up to him, he'll wish he hadn't toyed with us.
We'll make him pay eventually.
Sounds good to me.
Ready to move when you are.
I'll be ready with any number of regulation-approved punishments when the opportunity arises.
I'll follow your lead whenever you're ready.
Heh. Looks like our missile did more than just open the door. Not bad.
How do we know this isn't a trick? Maybe you're thinking of running off again.
I couldn't run if I wanted to. I'll catch up when the coast is clear--really.
Hmm. His injuries are real enough, Captain. He isn't likely to flee in his current state.
There you go. I'll be right behind you, go on.
I'm going in!
You can meet me at these coordinates. It's a set of caves, used to be some kind of training center.
I've destroyed the anti-missile turrets.
Much appreciated. We're going to be ready to launch in no time.
Let's get back to helping these poor, pitiful Balmorrans. Now that the sensors are gone, I need you to hit the Imps' anti-missile turrets. Think you can handle that?
I can handle a few turrets.
Affirmative.
Good deal.
Are you doing anything in this plan?
Why can't you do it?
I'm still programming this missile to be sure it hits its target. We wouldn't want to waste all your effort.
You're pushing it.
Not at all. This really is a critical objective, believe me.
Keep in touch. Vik out.
All right... I think I'd better hang back for now. That beating the Imps gave me did a little more damage than I thought.
I'll catch up once you've cleared out Orus's security droids, all right?
Hold this position while I clear the area.
Understood.
Heh. Yes, sir, Captain, sir.
How can I put you in my squad when I've never seen you fight?
I want to see your skills.
How can you put me in your squad if I'm dead? I'm in no shape to fight.
You've tried to trick me before.
You could be faking.
Why would I run off? I'm not going anywhere until I get my share of this loot.
I'll be right behind you. Trust me.
